clinical_study.brief_title: Perioperative Analgesia for Total Hip Arthroplasty
clinical_study.official_title: Perioperative Analgesia for Total Hip Arthroplasty: Lumbar Plexus Block Using Shamrock Technique Versus Fascia Iliaca Block

brief_summary.textblock: This study is comparing the effect of lumbar plexus block and fascia iliaca block with general anesthesia to provide perioperative pain control and compare their effects on hemodynamics

detailed_description.textblock:
Different groups receive different interventions at same time during study. patients were randomly allocated in two groups :
Group A: lumbar plexus block using shamrock technique by 0.3 ml/kg of 0.5% bupivacaine with 1:200000 adrenaline.
Group B: Fascia iliaca block by 0.3 ml/kg of 0.5% bupivacaine with 1:200000 adrenaline.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This study is comparing the effect of Lumbar plexus block and fascia iliaca block with general anesthesia to provide perioperative pain control and compare their effects on hemodynamics.
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: each patient was assessed by visual analogue scale which consists of a 10 cm line with one end labelled "no pain" and the other end labelled "worst pain imaginable". The patient marks the line at the point that best describes the pain intensity

secondary_outcome.measure: Compare effects of both groups on mean arterial blood pressure
secondary_outcome.description: monitoring of blood pressure using non invasive blood pressure measurement in millimeter mercury

other_outcome.measure: compare their effects on heart rate (beat\minute)
other_outcome.description: monitoring of heart rate using pulse oximetry in beat\minute

other_outcome.measure: Complication rate for procedures in the form of local anesthetic toxicity
other_outcome.description: observation of occurrence of local anesthetic toxicity as hypotension, seizures, bradycardia

arm_group.description: patients were recieved lumbar plexus block ultrasound guided by shamrock technique using 0.5% bupavacaine in a dose 0.3ml/kg
patients were received fascia iliaca block ultrasound guided using 0.5% bupoavacaine in a dose 0.3ml\kg

intervention.description: regional anesthesia to block lumbar plexus for analgesia of lower limb

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ASA physical status I-II and scheduled for elective total hip arthroplasty
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who refuse to participate.
- Local infection.
- Patients with coagulation defects
